intro: Strychnos pseudoquina, commonly known as the false strychnos, is a shrub or small tree native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Loganiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain seeds with a distinctive, angular shape. It is often found in moist, well-drained soils in forested or disturbed habitats. Due to its toxic properties, it is not typically used in traditional medicine or horticulture.
